description: A path-counting array, read by rows: T(i,j)=number of paths from (0,0) to (i-j,j) using steps (1 unit right and 1 unit up) or (1 unit right and 2 units up).
comments: If m >= 1 and n >= 2, then T(m+n-1,m) is the number of strings (s(1),s(2),...,s(n)) of nonnegative integers satisfying s(n)=m and 1<=s(k)-s(k-1)<=2 for k=2,3,...,n.
author: _Clark Kimberling_, May 07 2000
